citation.abstract: A series of novel 5-alkyl-6-adamantylmethylpyrimidin-4(3H)-ones bearing various substituents at the C-2 position of the pyrimidinone ring were synthesized using a facile route and evaluated for their anti-HIV activity in MT-4 cells. The biological results demonstrated that the majority of the newly designed compounds possessed moderate efficiency in inhibiting the replication of the wild-type (WT) HIV-1 strain (IIIB ) with EC50 values in the range from 0.10 μM to 5.39 μM. Among them, 5b1 and 5b3 proved to be the two most active inhibitors against WT HIV-1 with EC50 values of 0.10 μM and 0.12 μM, respectively, which were more active than nevirapine (NVP) in the same assay. In addition, HIV-1 reverse transcriptase (RT) inhibition assay indicated that the representative compound 5b1 displayed affinity to WT HIV-1 RT, and inhibited the activity of RT with an IC50 value superior to the reference drug NVP. Moreover, the preliminary structure-activity relationship (SAR) and the molecular modeling analysis of these new derivatives are also discussed. This article is protected by copyright. All rights reserved.
citation.title: Design, Synthesis and Biological Evaluation of Novel 5-Alkyl-6-Adamantylmethylpyrimidin-4(3H)-ones as HIV-1 non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors

news.title: Design, Synthesis and Biological Evaluation of Novel 5‐Alkyl‐6‐Adamantylmethylpyrimidin‐4(3H)‐ones as HIV‐1 non‐nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors
news.summary: Abstract A series of novel 5‐alkyl‐6‐adamantylmethylpyrimidin‐4(3H)‐ones bearing various substituents at the C‐2 position of the pyrimidinone ring were synthesized using a facile route and evaluated for their anti‐HIV activity in MT‐4 cells.
